parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: From pais; to train up a child, i.e. Educate, or, discipline.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: Perhaps from a and the middle voice of rheo; to contradict, i.e. Disavow, reject, abnegate.
Impiety, irreverence, ungodliness, wickedness. From asebes; impiety, i.e. wickedness.
From kosmos; terrene, literally or figuratively.
Desire, eagerness for, inordinate desire, lust. From epithumeo; a longing.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To live, be alive. A primary verb; to live.
Soberly, with moderation, prudently. Adverb from sophron; with sound mind, i.e. Moderately.
Justly, righteously. Adverb from dikaios; equitably.
Piously, religiously. Adverb from eusebes; piously.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A primary particle of present time; 'now'; also as noun or adjective present or immediate.
From the same as aei; properly, an age; by extension, perpetuity; by implication, the world; specially a Messianic period.
